title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 263.14 - Declaration
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 263.14 - Declaration

State Regulations

The term
declaration, as used in this

Part, shall mean a statement that is made under penalty of perjury but is not
sworn to before a notary or other person entitled to administer oaths. In any
case brought under the FLFLPA, any documents submitted may be supported, evidenced, established, or proved by the unsworn declaration of the filing
party. The declaration must state that the contents of the filing are declared
as true under penalty of perjury under the laws of the State of New York. The
declaration must be dated. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
263.14

Adopted

New

York State Register February 15, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 07, eff. 2/15/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
